Sudoku Solver Module

class sudoku_solver.SudokuSolver(filename)

Class to solve a sudoku

__dict__ = mappingproxy({'__module__': 'sudoku_solver', '__doc__': 'Class to solve a sudoku', '__init__': <function SudokuSolver.__init__>, 'read_board_from_file': <function SudokuSolver.read_board_from_file>, 'check_possible_indicies': <function SudokuSolver.check_possible_indicies>, 'solve_sudoku': <function SudokuSolver.solve_sudoku>, 'format_sudoku_board': <function SudokuSolver.format_sudoku_board>, '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'SudokuSolver' objects>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'SudokuSolver' objects>, '__annotations__': {}})
__init__(filename)

Initialises the sudoku board from a given file

__module__ = 'sudoku_solver'
__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

check_possible_indicies(x, y, n)

Checks if a certain indicies is possible on a certain grid of the sudoku board

board: list(list(int))

The current state of the sudoku board

x: int

Column number of the sudoku board

y: int

Row number of the sudoku board

n: int

indicie to check in the grid square

Boolean

True if number is allowed, False otherwise

format_sudoku_board()

Formats the sudoku board

formated_board: str

The formatted sudoku board

read_board_from_file(filename)

Reads a sudoku puzzle from a text file and converts it into a list of lists where each sublist represents a row of the sudoku

filename: str

numbers for the initial sudoku board

list(int)

A list of lists representing each row of the initial sudoko board

solve_sudoku()

Solves the sudoku by recurssion of possbile indicies

board: list(list(int))

The current state of the sudoku board

board: list(list(int))

The solved sudoku board

sudoku_solver.main()
